title: Your Monday Briefing: NATO Prepares to Meet
description: Also, Janet Yellen leaves Beijing with hope, but no breakthroughs.

title: Henry Kamm, Pulitzer-Winning New York Times Journalist, Dies at 98
description: In a 47-year career at The Times, he covered Cold War diplomacy in Europe, famine in Africa and genocide in Indochina.

title: BBC Suspends Male Staff Member After Report of Payments for Sexual Images
description: A report in The Sun newspaper said that an unnamed male presenter at the BBC had paid tens of thousands of pounds to a teenager in exchange for “sexually explicit photographs.”

title: Pope Francis Names 21 New Cardinals, With a Focus Beyond Europe
description: In choosing men from around the world for the college that will elect his successor, the pontiff aimed to reflect “the universality of the church.”

title: Ukraine Celebrates Return of Azov Commanders Held as Prisoners of War
description: Five members of the regiment returned home from Turkey to a heroes’ welcome on Saturday. The Kremlin accused Ankara of violating the terms of the deal that freed them.

title: Ukraine Celebrates Return of Azov Commanders Held as Prisoners of War
description: Five members of the regiment returned home from Turkey to a heroes’ welcome on Saturday. The Kremlin accused Ankara of violating the terms of the deal that freed them.

title: Threads Takes on Twitter
description: How Meta did what no other Twitter competitor could.

title: Migrant Numbers on Border Plunge as Mexico Helps U.S. to Stem Flow
description: Mexico is taking steps to keep migrants from massing along the border. But as they flow into southern Mexico the calm may be short-lived.

title: Defecting From North Korea Is Now Far Harder
description: Recent rescue efforts to escape Kim Jong-un’s regime via China have been thwarted by digital surveillance, profiteering and the pandemic.

title: Pantheon Tickets Frustrate Tourists in Rome
description: There is now a 5 euro fee to get into one of Italy’s most popular sites, but the process has been bewildering for some, and there are fears the system could be abused.

title: Janet Yellen’s Trip to China: No Breakthroughs But 10 Hours of Talks
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, after 10 hours of meetings with Chinese officials, said the two sides would pursue “more frequent communication” despite their deep differences.

title: Another Generation of Riots in France, as Seen From Clichy-Sous-Bois
description: France spent billions of euros to revive poor areas after the protests that ignited in Clichy-sous-Bois in 2005. Amid another outpouring of rage, people want to know what went wrong.

title: NATO Tries to Remember What It Means to Fight a European War
description: Supporting Ukraine and clarifying its relationship with the alliance will be a dominant theme at an upcoming summit. But NATO’s efforts to strengthen its own defenses along its eastern flank will also be key.
